definitions.definition: To constitute in parts, each having a special function, act, office, or relation; to systematize.
(chiefly used in the past participle) To furnish with organs; to give an organic structure to; to endow with capacity for the functions of life
To band together into a group or union that can bargain and act collectively; to unionize.
definitions.example: the workers decided to organize; their next task was to organize the workers at the steel mill

definitions.definition: Of a person, characterised by efficient organization.
definitions.example: Your work desk is so neat and tidy - I've never met someone so organized before!
